intro: Aframmi angolense, commonly known as wild turnip, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its rough, hairy stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Its fruits are three-lobed capsules that contain numerous seeds. Aframmi angolense is often found in disturbed habitats and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
